meanings.definition: The action of blowing or breathing into something.
meanings.sent1: The insufflation of air into the balloon made it expand.
meanings.sent2: The insufflation of birthday candles is a fun tradition.
meanings.sent3: He tried insufflation to inflate the beach ball but ended up out of breath.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an insufflation of joy into the room.
meanings.sent5: The insufflation of wind into the sails propelled the boat forward.

meanings.definition: The act of introducing a substance into the body through the nose or mouth by inhaling.
meanings.sent1: Doctors use insufflation to deliver medication directly to the lungs.
meanings.sent2: The insufflation of smoke can be harmful to the respiratory system.
meanings.sent3: The insufflation of spicy food made his nose tingle.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an insufflation of wisdom into his mind.
meanings.sent5: The insufflation of perfume brought back memories of her grandmother.
